articles.title: You can preorder the AirPods Pro 3 right now
articles.description: Apple’s most impressive wireless earbuds are now available to preorder from Amazon, Best Buy, Walmart, and Target for $249. The new AirPods Pro 3 won’t arrive until September 19th, but you can place your order from the retailer of your choice, then be among the first to dig into their premium featur
articles.content: The AirPods Pro 3 will hit stores on September 19th for $249. Apple’s most impressive wireless earbuds are now available to preorder from Amazon , Best Buy , Walmart , and Target for $249. The new AirPods Pro 3 won’t arrive until September 19th, but you can place your order from the retailer of your choice, then be among the first to dig into their premium features on launch day. AirPods Pro 3 The third-gen AirPods Pro add a new built-in heart rate sensor and live translation feature. They also
articles.author: Sheena Vasani

articles.description: Anduril has landed a lucrative contract and is bringing its uncrewed undersea vehicle Ghost Shark to Australian waters next year.

articles.title: The Download: AI’s energy future
articles.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Video: AI and our energy future In May, MIT Technology Review published an unprecedented and comprehensive look at how much energy the AI industry use
articles.content: This is today’s edition of The Download , our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Video: AI and our energy future In May, MIT Technology Review published an unprecedented and comprehensive look at how much energy the AI industry uses—down to a single query. Our reporters and editors traced where AI’s carbon footprint stands now, and where it’s headed, as AI barrels towards billions of daily users. We’ve just produced a short vi
articles.author: Rhiannon Williams

articles.title: Reddit, Yahoo, Medium and more are adopting a new licensing standard to get compensated for AI scraping
articles.description: With web publishers in crisis , a new open standard lets them set the ground rules for AI scrapers. (Or, at least it will try .) The new Really Simple Licensing (RSL) standard creates terms that participants expect AI companies to abide by. Although enforcement is an open question, it can't hurt
articles.content: With web publishers in crisis , a new open standard lets them set the ground rules for AI scrapers. (Or, at least it will try .) The new Really Simple Licensing (RSL) standard creates terms that participants expect AI companies to abide by. Although enforcement is an open question, it can't hurt that some heavy hitters back it. Among others, the list includes Reddit, Yahoo (Engadget's parent company), Medium and People Inc. RSL adds licensing terms to the robots.txt protocol, the simple
articles.author: Will Shanklin

articles.title: Developers joke about “coding like cavemen” as AI service suffers major outage
articles.description: Anthropic outage takes down AI tools some developers rely on to create software.
articles.content: On Wednesday afternoon, Anthropic experienced a brief but complete service outage that took down its AI infrastructure, leaving developers unable to access Claude.ai, the API, Claude Code, or the management console for around half an hour. The outage affected all three of Anthropic's main services simultaneously, with the company posting at 12:28 pm Eastern that "APIs, Console, and Claude.ai are down. Services will be restored as soon as possible." As of press time, the services appear to be res
articles.author: Benj Edwards

articles.title: Porfolio Updates
articles.description: I've been giving my portfolio website a major visual upgrade! I'll be completely honest, I’m no graphic designer....but I DO know how to bring said designs to life through code. Using a mix of tools and creative tweaks, I’ve made the UI cleaner...and way more stylish. I additionally added a French l
articles.content: I've been giving my portfolio website a major visual upgrade! I'll be completely honest, I’m no graphic designer....but I DO know how to bring said designs to life through code. Using a mix of tools and creative tweaks, I’ve made the UI cleaner...and way more stylish. I additionally added a French language toggle, showcasing my bilingual skills and making the site more accessible. Next up, I’m exploring new icon colors to refine the overall look. I don't exactly know if they fit the aesthetic cu
articles.author: Jake Soucy

articles.title: Lyft launches autonomous fleet with May Mobility in Atlanta
articles.description: Lyft and May Mobility have teamed up to launch a fleet of autonomous vehicles in Atlanta. It's a pilot program, so it's currently only available to Lyft riders in the area of midtown Atlanta. The companies promise a "measured, safety-first approach" with this rollout. The fleet consists of h
articles.content: Lyft and May Mobility have teamed up to launch a fleet of autonomous vehicles in Atlanta. It's a pilot program, so it's currently only available to Lyft riders in the area of midtown Atlanta. The companies promise a "measured, safety-first approach" with this rollout. The fleet consists of hybrid-electric Toyota Sienna Autono-MaaS vehicles equipped with May Mobility’s self-driving technology. Lyft and May Mobility announced this partnership last year , but Atlanta is the first city to ge
articles.author: Lawrence Bonk

articles.title: 'No Tax on Tips' apparently also applies to your favorite streamer
articles.description: Streamers, YouTubers and other content creators are eligible for the new "No Tax on Tips" policy in the One Big Beautiful Bill Act President Donald Trump signed into law on July 4, 2024. "Digital Content Creators" are included in a preliminary list of occupations that are eligible for the new tax de
articles.content: Streamers, YouTubers and other content creators are eligible for the new "No Tax on Tips" policy in the One Big Beautiful Bill Act President Donald Trump signed into law on July 4, 2024. "Digital Content Creators" are included in a preliminary list of occupations that are eligible for the new tax deduction on tips the US Treasury Department released last week. That means a podcaster could receive the same tax relief as a waiter or bartender. Under that guidance, the "Bits" received during a Twit
articles.author: Ian Carlos Campbell

articles.title: Grammarly's AI writing assistance tools now work in five new languages
articles.description: Since its debut in 2009, Grammarly has only been available in one language: English. Sure, you could switch between dialects, including Canadian and Indian English, but if you wrote in any other language, you were out of luck. That's changing today with Grammarly rolling out beta support for fiv
articles.content: Since its debut in 2009, Grammarly has only been available in one language: English. Sure, you could switch between dialects, including Canadian and Indian English, but if you wrote in any other language, you were out of luck. That's changing today with Grammarly rolling out beta support for five additional languages: French, German, Italian, Portuguese and Spanish. The update is available to all Grammarly customers — whether you live in a country that speaks the language you want to write i
articles.author: Engadget

articles.title: We built stackoverflow.ai with the community and for the community
articles.description: Ryan is joined by our very own Ash Zade, Staff Product Manager, and Alex Warren, Staff Software Engineer, to discuss our newly released stackoverflow.ai, how it’s enhancing user experience by combining human-validated answers with AI, and our future plans for deeper personalization and community int
articles.content: Ryan is joined by our very own Ash Zade, Staff Product Manager, and Alex Warren, Staff Software Engineer, to discuss our newly released stackoverflow.ai, how it’s enhancing user experience by combining human-validated answers with AI, and our future plans for deeper personalization and community integration.
articles.author: Phoebe Sajor

articles.title: Spotify peeved after 10,000 users sold data to build AI tools
articles.description: Spotify sent a warning to stop data sales, but developers say they never got it.
articles.content: For millions of Spotify users, the "Wrapped" feature—which crunches the numbers on their annual listening habits—is a highlight of every year's end, ever since it debuted in 2015. NPR once broke down exactly why our brains find the feature so "irresistible," while Cosmopolitan last year declared that sharing Wrapped screenshots of top artists and songs had by now become "the ultimate status symbol" for tens of millions of music fans. It's no surprise then that, after a decade, some Spotify users
articles.author: Ashley Belanger

articles.title: Exploring Azure Functions for Synthetic Monitoring with Playwright: A Complete Guide - Part 2
articles.description: Introduction In the first article, we explored how to build a synthetic monitoring solution with Azure Functions and Playwright. Now, we'll dive deep into the reporting mechanism - the crucial component that transforms test results into actionable insights by sending telemetry to Application Insight
articles.content: Introduction In the first article, we explored how to build a synthetic monitoring solution with Azure Functions and Playwright. Now, we'll dive deep into the reporting mechanism - the crucial component that transforms test results into actionable insights by sending telemetry to Application Insights and storing test artifacts in Azure Blob Storage. This article focuses on the Test Results Processing layer of our architecture, explaining how the custom Playwright reporter works, when and how it
articles.author: Nathan Araújo

articles.description: For promising Gen Z students, a career as a software developer seemed like the golden ticket to career stability and success. But in the age of AI, the career promise for Gen Z software developers is gone.

Our AI honorees include people who steer model development at Silicon Valley’s biggest tech firms and academic researchers who develop new

articles.title: RAG-Powered Chat: OpenAI & ChromaDB Integration
articles.description: In the world of AI-driven applications, the ability to chat with your own data is a game-changer. Imagine an assistant that doesn't just rely on its pre-trained knowledge but can instantly learn from documents you provide. That's the power of Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), and today we're goi
articles.content: In the world of AI-driven applications, the ability to chat with your own data is a game-changer. Imagine an assistant that doesn't just rely on its pre-trained knowledge but can instantly learn from documents you provide. That's the power of Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), and today we're going to build a complete web application that brings this concept to life. This guide will walk you through the development of "Chat RAG", a full-stack application featuring a React/Typescript frontend
articles.author: Gabriel Melendez

articles.title: PlayStation launches new app for parental controls
articles.description: PlayStation is launching a new PlayStation Family app for iOS and Android to help parents manage their child’s playtime on PS5 and PS4. Parents can already set parental control features directly on a console, but this app gives parents another way to set limits and keep track of what their kid is pl
articles.content: PlayStation is launching a new PlayStation Family app for iOS and Android to help parents manage their child’s playtime on PS5 and PS4. Parents can already set parental control features directly on a console, but this app gives parents another way to set limits and keep track of what their kid is playing. “The app includes a number of new customizable features for parents to manage their children’s playtime, including an activity report, more visibility into what their children are playing, and
articles.author: Jay Peters

articles.title: Microsoft ends OpenAI exclusivity in Office, adds rival Anthropic
articles.description: Microsoft will end OpenAI's exclusive hold on its productivity suite, adding second AI supplier.
articles.content: Microsoft's Office 365 suite will soon incorporate AI models from Anthropic alongside existing OpenAI technology, The Information reported , ending years of exclusive reliance on OpenAI for generative AI features across Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook. The shift reportedly follows internal testing that revealed Anthropic's Claude Sonnet 4 model excels at specific Office tasks where OpenAI's models fall short, particularly in visual design and spreadsheet automation, according to sources fam

articles.title: Can we please keep our broadband money, Republican governor asks Trump admin
articles.description: Governor worries Trump won't let states spend entire $42 billion broadband fund.
articles.content: Louisiana Governor Jeff Landry has a simple request for the Trump administration: Don't take our broadband money away. Trump's Commerce Department rewrote the rules of the $42 billion Broadband Equity, Access, and Deployment (BEAD) grant program, forcing states to change how they spend money earmarked for expanding broadband access. The overhaul led states to reduce spending on fiber networks and increase spending on satellite—although not to the extent sought by SpaceX CEO Elon Musk, who is dem
articles.author: Jon Brodkin

articles.title: Apple isn’t packing a charging cable in with the AirPods Pro 3
articles.description: The AirPods Pro 3 seem like a solid upgrade, but they have one significant drawback: Apple isn’t including a charging cable in the box, MacRumors reports. Apple spells it out right on the AirPods Pro 3 tech specs page, saying in the “In the Box” section that “USB‑C Charge Cable sold separately.” Tha
articles.content: The AirPods Pro 3 seem like a solid upgrade , but they have one significant drawback: Apple isn’t including a charging cable in the box, MacRumors reports . Apple spells it out right on the AirPods Pro 3 tech specs page , saying in the “In the Box” section that “USB‑C Charge Cable sold separately.” That means that if you want to charge the case for the AirPods Pro 3, you’ll need to use a charging cable you already have, buy a new one, or use a wireless charger. For a lot of people, this may not
articles.author: Jay Peters

articles.title: Adapting to new threats with proactive risk management
articles.description: In July 2024, a botched update to the software defenses managed by cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike caused more than 8 million Windows systems to fail. From hospitals to manufacturers, stock markets to retail stores, the outage caused parts of the global economy to grind to a halt. Payment systems wer
articles.content: In July 2024, a botched update to the software defenses managed by cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike caused more than 8 million Windows systems to fail. From hospitals to manufacturers, stock markets to retail stores, the outage caused parts of the global economy to grind to a halt. Payment systems were disrupted, broadcasters went off the air, and flights were canceled. In all, the outage is estimated to have caused direct losses of more than $5 billion to Fortune 500 companies. For US air carrier
articles.author: MIT Technology Review Insights

articles.title: The best iPad to buy
articles.description: There are no bad iPads. That’s the best news about Apple’s tablet lineup: 15 years after Steve Jobs first debuted the device, the iPad is the best tablet on the market, and it’s not particularly close. Apple’s App Store is enormous and filled with great apps, Apple’s performance and battery life are
articles.content: The iPad is still the best tablet on the market. | Image: Cath Virginia / The Verge There are no bad iPads. That’s the best news about Apple’s tablet lineup: 15 years after Steve Jobs first debuted the device, the iPad is the best tablet on the market, and it’s not particularly close. Apple’s App Store is enormous and filled with great apps, Apple’s performance and battery life are consistently excellent, and the iPad is still the company’s most versatile device. That’s one easy answer to your q
articles.author: David Pierce

articles.title: How to use the GitHub and JFrog integration for secure, traceable builds from commit to production
articles.description: Connect commits to artifacts without switching tools. The post How to use the GitHub and JFrog integration for secure, traceable builds from commit to production appeared first on The GitHub Blog .
articles.content: Today, we’re introducing a new integration between GitHub and JFrog that connects your source code and your attested binaries in one secure, traceable workflow. For developers who often find themselves jumping between multiple tools to figure out which commit produced which artifact — or piecing together results from separate security scans for code and binaries — this integration can save time and effort, centralizing everything you need all in one place. Below, we’ll di
articles.author: April Yoho
